pages.text: Now that you're familiar with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment), you see no reason to lug it around like you did in the Middle Ages. You have found a way to convert [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) into a higher form of energy!\You called it [#](157687)I[#](aa32a0)n[#](f0af15)k[#]().

pages.title: Producing & Storing
pages.text: [Pigment](entry://general/pigment) can be converted to Ink using the [Color Picker](entry://magic/color_picker) and then extracted into containers, like [Ink Flasks](entry://magic/ink_flask).\\The only drawback: deprived of it's physical form, there is no way to transform Ink back into [Pigment](entry://general/pigment).

pages.title: Transfer
pages.text: Ink behaves very much like a liquid. It flows from where it is abundant to where is little.

\When two objects that store Ink are connected - such as a [Color Picker](entry://magic/color_picker) and an [Ink Flask](entry://magic/ink_flask) - the Ink between the two containers slowly evens out.\The greater the difference, the faster the Flask is getting filled.
